body:
Comment 1: 
I can't reproduce this, but I don't have a Pentium 3.
I can't think of any reason that the Pentium 3 wouldn't work.
Usually the issue with older chips is using an unsupported
instruction, but that causes an immediate SIGILL or some such,
not memory corruption.

After the test fails, it should leave a file named 8.out
in /home/Checkouts/Mercurial/Go/src/pkg/big.
Could you try running that exact binary on the Xeon
and see if it works there?

Also, please try running 

    GOGC=1 8.out

on both machines and see if that makes the problem more likely.

Either way, please put the 8.out in a zip file and attach it to this
report.  I'd like to take a look at the exact code that's being run.
_Status changed to **WaitingForReply**._
